item.title: Learning Angular: Set your language culture before any UI is displayed

item.title: Learning Angular: Verifying whether a function has been passed to my directive's isolated scope
item.description: When you create isolated directives, you usually use the scope property to define your directive's external API. Some of the APIs properties might be mandatory while others are optional and based on that state, your directive might react differently.

item.title: Learning Angular: Access directive scope variables from directive controllers and vice versa
item.description: Angular directives can have a separate, isolated scope, which is even the suggested approach most of the time. And they can have directive controllers. But…how do I access the directive’s scope variables from the directive controller and vice-versa?
